alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Kentucky, including the following counties, Boone, Campbell, Grant, Kenton, Owen and Pendleton. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Independence, Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Monterey, Gratz, Stewartsville, Twin Bridges, Holbrook, Lawrenceville, Needmore, Sherman, Northcutt, Williamstown Lake, Long Ridge, Verona, Elk Lake and Knoxville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
